result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett Coleman Baker

defendant.name: Baker, Brett Coleman
defendant.address: 1909 West Drexel Avenue, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brett Coleman Baker in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Brett Coleman Baker.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests possible plea hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court reinstates JusticePoint supervision level 3.  
Court modifies no weapons order to no weapons except for work tools.

Defendant Brett Coleman Baker in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Brett Coleman Baker.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has offer but not discovery and requests additional pretrial conference date.  Court reinstates JusticePoint Supervision level 3.  Victim AIW appeared in person and requested no contact order modification.  Discussion placed on the record.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies modification of no contact order.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Violation (DISCHARGE - Missed Initial Appointment) Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with AIW.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brett Coleman Baker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Brett Coleman Baker.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Brett Coleman Baker not in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@2p
